The Challenge of Finding Exoplanets: Discovering exoplanets is no easy task. Planets are typically billions of times fainter than the stars they orbit, and they are incredibly distant. These factors make detecting them extremely difficult. Scientists face four primary challenges when searching for exoplanets including: Planets are small and faint compared to stars, Planets don't produce any light of their own, Planets are far away from us, Planets are faint against the bright backdrop of stars. To overcome these challenges, scientists use a variety of techniques to detect exoplanets.
